net.hudup.listener

Class Listener

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.AbstractRunner
      • net.hudup.listener.SocketServer
        • net.hudup.listener.Listener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, Gateway, Server, ServerStatusListener, Runner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Balancer

    public class Listener
extends SocketServer
implements ServerStatusListener, Gateway
    Because server supports many clients, it is more effective if deploying server on different platforms. It means that we can distribute service layer and interface layer in different sites. Site can be a personal computer, mainframe, etc. There are many scenarios of distribution, for example, many sites for service layer and one site for interface layer. Interface layer has another component - listener component which is responsible for supporting distributed deployment. Listener which has load balancing function is called balancer. For example, service layer is deployed on three sites and balancer is deployed on one site; whenever balancer receives user request, it looks up service sites and choose the site whose recommender service is least busy to require such recommender service to perform recommendation task. Load balancing improves system performance and supports a huge of clients. Note that it is possible for the case that balancer or listener is deployed on more than one site.
    The listener is modeled as this Listener class. Listener is also a Server but it is not recommendation server. Listener is deployed in interface layer, which supports distributed environment. Listener stores a list of binded servers. Note, binded server is represented by BindServer class. It can bind a new server by setting configuration and calling rebind() method. In case that there are many binded servers and one Listener then, Listener is responsible for dispatching user requests to its proper binded server. Listener starts, pauses, resumes, and stops by its methods start(), SocketServer.pause(), SocketServer.resume(), and stop(), respectively.
    Because listener binds servers, it implements ServerStatusListener in order to receive server statuses. Because listener exposes a gateway that allows a control panel to control it, it implements Gateway interface.
    Note, the sub-architecture of recommendation server (recommender) is inspired from the architecture of Oracle database management system (Oracle DBMS); especially concepts of listener and share memory layer are borrowed from concepts "Listener" and "System Global Area" of Oracle DBMS, respectively, available at https://docs.oracle.com/database/122/index.htm.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • bindServerList

        protected BindServerList bindServerList
        Listener stores a list of binded servers. Such list is referred by this variable.

      • registry

        protected java.rmi.registry.Registry registry
        RMI registry to register the gateway of listener as RMI object for remote calling. Such gateway allows remote control panel to control this listener remotely.

      • delegate

        protected AbstractDelegator delegate(java.net.Socket socket)
        Description copied from class: SocketServer
        When socket server receive incoming request, it dispatches such request to a delegator represented by AbstractDelegator so that such delegator handles and processes the request. This method is responsible for creating the delegator with specified network socket at first. Later on method SocketServer.task() will dispatch incomming request to the returned delegator.
        Specified by:
        delegate in class SocketServer
        Parameters:
        socket - specified network socket
        Returns:
        returned delegator which handles and processes incoming request later.

      • serverTasks

        protected void serverTasks()
        Description copied from class: SocketServer
        The internal SocketServer.timer is responsible for making scheduler of server tasks. In every interval in mili-seconds, the SocketServer.timer calls the method SocketServer.callServerTasks() which in turn calls the method SocketServer.serverTasks(). Specified tasks of server are coded in the method SocketServer.serverTasks().
        Specified by:
        serverTasks in class SocketServer

      • getGatewayBindUri

        protected xURI getGatewayBindUri()
        For security, each listener exposes a gateway that allowing remote control panel to control this listener remotely. This method returns the URI of such gateway.
        Returns:
        gateway bind xURI

      • createSysTray

        protected boolean createSysTray()
        When listener started, it has an icon together a pop-up menu on system tray of operating system. This method creates such icon and pop-up menu. The icon indicates current status of listener and the pop-up menu is to show the control panel that allows users to control the listener.
        Returns:
        whether create successfully the icon together the pop-up menu on system tray of operating system.

      • showCP

        protected void showCP()
        This method creates and shows the control panel represented by ListenerCP class that allows users to control this listener such as starting and stopping listener. The control panel can connect the listener remotely.

      • create

        public static Listener create()
        This static method is used to create listener from the default listener configuration specified by ListenerConfig.listenerConfig.
        Returns:
        Listener from the default balancer configuration specified by ListenerConfig.listenerConfig.
